IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
NARRATIVE: 
On August 22, 2023, Tfc. Arment #6828 of the MSP CED North Central Region Investigators was requested to conduct further investigation into suspicious pawn transactions. Tfc. Arment reviewed CIS/RAPID notice (MP-202306-0068-BRIC) and learned the following:
- Between 12/23/2022 and 06/21/2023 Deonte Johnson-Mays conducted 34 pawn transactions totaling $7,950.00
- Notice indicates that Johnson-Mays has an outstanding arrest warrant through Baltimore City Police Department
- Notice indicates that Johnson-Mays has prior criminal history of theft and CDS related charges
- Notice indicates that Johnson-Mays resides in Baltimore, Maryland

Tfc. Arment conducted a wanted check of Johnson-Mays, which yielded negative results. Further investigation revealed Johnson-Mays was apprehended by law enforcement shortly after CIS/RAPID notice MP-202306-0068-BRIC was disseminated to law enforcement. Tfc. Arment conducted a query of Leads Online for Johnson-Mays, which revealed as of 08/21/2023 Johnson-Mays has conducted additional pawn transactions. Tfc. Arment observed a majority of the pawn transactions to occur at "Fast Cash Pawnbrokers" located in Dundalk, Maryland. Tfc. Arment observed a majority of the pawn transactions to include "NIB" in the description, which Tfc. Arment knows from previous investigations to be new in box items. Tfc. Arment observed a majority of the transactions to include various power tools. The query yielded a telephone number for Johnson-Mays as 443-823-2580. Further investigation showed 443-823-2580 to be associated with Johnson-Mays and the service provider to be AT&T Mobility LLC. Tfc. Arment conducted a query of the commercially purchased data tool "TLO" for Johnson-Mays. The query indicates an address for Johnson-Mays as 7118 Gough St., Baltimore, Maryland. Tfc. Arment observed the address to be located within a one-mile radius of 6315 Eastern Avenue, Baltimore, Maryland (The Home Depot). The query was logged in accordance with agency policy. Further investigative efforts will be captured in additional updates. 

Tfc. Arment conducted the following in furtherance of this investigation:
- Contact was made with Det. Childs of the Baltimore County Police Department (Burglary/Pawn Section) to deconflict, Det. Childs advised they are familiar with Johnson-Mays and that he was the suspect in a previous theft investigation at Home Depot which was handled by officers from the White Marsh precinct. Det. Childs advised BCPD does not have any open cases involving Johnson-Mays and there are no issues regarding deconfliction.
- Tfc. Arment made contact with Gerald D'Angelo, Home Depot Corporate Investigator of the Mid-Atlantic Region. D'Angelo advised asset protection is familiar with Johnson-Mays. D'Angelo provided LPR hits for Johnson-Mays' vehicle
- Tfc. Arment reviewed LPR hits at various Home Depot stores throughout Baltimore County. Tfc. Arment observed the LPR hits to coincide with multiple pawn transactions conducted by Johnson-Mays at "Fast Cash Pawnbrokers".
- At the time of this briefing, Johnson-Mays has conducted additional pawn transactions for various power tools. D'Angelo advised that his team is reviewing surveillance footage, which will be provided to Tfc. Arment. 

On September 05, 2023, Tfc. Arment was contacted by Special Agent Michael Shao of Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) in reference to "Fast Cash Pawnbrokers". Special Agent Shao advised Tfc. Arment that HSI was in the preliminary stages of investigation into "Fast Cash Pawnbrokers". Special Agent Shao was seeking to deconflict and assist MSP with any active investigations into the business. Tfc. Arment made contact with D/Sgt. Haas, RAPID Unit Commander to deconflict. D/Sgt. Haas advised he would be meeting with Special Agent Shao regarding the investigation. At this time, this investigation will be suspended pending further investigation from HSI and the RAPID Unit into Johnson-Mays and "Fast Cash Pawnbrokers". 

Case suspended. Events occurred in Baltimore City and Baltimore County.
